name: ferrosilicon production | ferrosilicon | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11517/documentation

Ferrosilicon (FeSi) is produced via reduction of silica sand in presence of iron in an electric arc furnace. Coke is used as reduction agent. FeSi is used in various metallurgical processes as reduction agent or alloying material. For the FeSi production process, the data on material consumption is based on an average of three Chinese companies which have been surveyed in 2008. 

The process starts with the reception of raw materials at the factory gate.

This activity ends with the production of ferrosilicon in an electric arc furnace. No further process steps are included.
category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/241:Manufacture of basic iron and steel/2410:Manufacture of basic iron and steel

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The module includes the production of the anode: the production of SÃ¶derberg paste has been developed according to data from ProBas (reference year 2003; www.probas.umweltbundesamt.de).; ;Theoretically, the main emission from the electric arc furnace where FeSi is produced is CO according to the following chemical reactions:;;SiO2 + 2C = Si + 2 CO;;SiO2 + C = SiO + CO;;;In reality, several further reactions lead to potential CO and CO2 emissions. Due to large uncertainties of the direct CO and CO2 emissions from the furnace, this module refers to the average amount of direct CO2 emissions from FeSi production which has been measured at Chinese Fe-alloy plants (Zhou 2001). Other elements of the off-gas are amorphous condensed SiO2, SO2 and NOx. The SiO2 dust is calculated in this study. It can be filtered and used for concrete or ceramic production. As there is no information whether this is done in China, there is no further use assumed. SO2 and NOx result from impurities of the raw materials and are not expected to be emitted in relevant amounts. Data on infrastructure is a rough estimation.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The dataset is scaled up from regional dataset for China. The uncertainties have been adjusted accordingly.
